item.title: About
item.description: Management README I was inspired by an article on Management README’s and thought it was high time I do something similar. This is mostly for folks I work with, but I hope it’s useful to anyone who interacts with me. I try to keep it up to date, but it may be six-plus months out of date. Hopefully I don’t change that much and it’s only just me gaining more insight about myself!

item.description: One of the core principles of modern “DevOps” development is to treat your documentation as code, just like code. My team at Cisco open sourced how we do that.

item.title: Terraform in AWS: use AMI Names not IDs - and is Terraform the right answer still?
item.description: In AWS the AMI ID for a particular VM image is unique to that region. But it’s name is consistent across AWS. When building infra-as-code (such as terraform) use the name, not the ID. And some musings on terraform. Is it still the right answer for infra-as-code?

item.title: Black Lives Matter
item.description: We all protest and effect change in our own ways. I choose mentorship, education, and work - because that’s what I can do best to make a difference.

item.title: RBOT Robotics Sensor/Acuator Board - Value Proposition
item.description: I’m building a board for robotics, but it’s also useful for IoT and home automation. What’s it do? What problem does it solve? It’s basically a WiFi interface to a variety of I2C-driven devices (motors or sensors). The I2C side is Engineered to be highly robust and reliable.

item.title: Boards!
item.description: I’m building a robotics board that basically is a WiFi REST interface to a variety of I2C sensors - the I2C side uses an I2C switch driven by an ESP32. My first RBOT board arrived, but alas, I got schooled on surface mount part numbering.

item.title: Ubuntu Again!
item.description: From 1997 to 2010 I believed it was only a matter of time before Linux on the desktop became a reality. I gave up in 2010 and went to OSX. But we may finally be close! Here’s my notes on installing Linux Ubuntu 18.04 on a Dell Inspiron 15 7000. It’s the easiest and happiest linux ever for me.

item.title: About
item.description: Projects This is a short list of projects I am currently working on (or have built and am actively using): GoNetMon - Network use visualization writting in GoLang, using Prometheus and Kibana ouilookup - CLI tool written in go to look up the vendor for a given MAC address PiBlaster-MQTT - port of PiBlaster to use MQTT instead of a local charachter device goxb_mqtt - native go code that reads from an XBox™ controller (using libusb) and sends events over MQTT

Greg Herlein San Francisco, CA gherlein@herlein.com github.com/gherlein +1-415-368-7546 Summary of Qualifications 10+ years Senior Engineering Leadership experience - teams up to 150 staff 10+ years distributed systems experience, 5+ years customer facing Extensive history migrating large-scale software to cloud-based SaaS deployments Strong software development, systems architecture, and operations experience Significant SRE background - treating operations as a software problem Reputation for building globally distributed teams “that don’t break” Cloud Expert - AWS Certified Solutions Architect, 10+ years of practical experience Agile Expert - scrum, kanban and scrumban used in production on multiple SaaS Excellent communicator at all levels - especially strong communicationg technical vision Immediately Relevant Experience Directly customer facing in 2019 consulting for a cloud-based 5G network buildout Two-years managing a team of solution architects migrating legacy apps to cloud-native Took multiple products to the cloud, often personally involved in the designs Certified AWS Solutions Architect (Associate) Proven history of attracting, developing and growing high-level techncial talent Work History Amazon AWS - Sr Manager, Solution Architecture (12⁄2020 to Present) Leadership role helping AWS customers adopt and scale into the AWS cloud Cisco - Director Software Engineering, CX Cloud (11⁄2014 to 12⁄2020) Currently leading a small, senior team of System Architects and Developers Solution will ingest product telemetry world-wide, at multi-petabyte scale All-AWS, will span across all product lines and Cisco interal IT Personally driving technical progress and making presentations at all levels Previously: led a team of about 100 Engineers refactoring systems moving to AWS Solution split across multiple customer sites and AWS Tech stack: AWS Aurora, lambda, S3, Fargate, ELK, java moving to golang Teams split across several US offices, Bangalore and Chennai India, remotes Previously: one year assignment building an SRE function for a cloud-based 5G network Deployed large-scale ELK-based logging/monitoring/observability framework Tech stack: OpenStack, Kubernetes (k8s), ELK, SNMP, Prometheus, golang Teams split across Japan, India, Europe and multiple US offices and remotes Previously: 2 years as Principal Architect for a group of over 600 Engineers Migrating from traditional Enterprise software to cloud-native DevOps-based SaaS Drove organization to develop all new software in AWS and Cisco’s OpenStack cloud Tech stack: terraform, ansible, helm, docker, k8s, Prometheus, Cassandra, Java Teams split across US offices, Bangalore and Chennai India, Vienna Austria, remotes
